episodeTitle: Eric Attacks! Great Escape from Warship Island!
description: The Straw Hats rush to escape from Warship Island with Ryu the ancient dragon before the Marines can capture them. Eric uses his Devil Fruit powers to attack Luffy while the crew prepares for a daring escape, with Zoro and Usopp positioning the ship as Nami and Apis load Ryu onto a cart.

events.title: Straw Hats Decide to Escape with Ryu
events.description: The Straw Hat crew makes the decision to help Apis and Ryu escape from Warship Island before the dragon dies. They recognize the urgency of returning Ryu to Dragon's Nest despite the Marines surrounding them.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' commitment to helping those in need, even in a filler arc. Sets up the main conflict of the episode.

quotes.text: We're getting that dragon back to his home no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring their intent to help Ryu despite the danger

events.title: Eric Attacks the Straw Hats
events.description: Eric, the mercenary with the Kama Kama no Mi Devil Fruit powers, launches his attack on the Straw Hat Pirates. He uses his razor-sharp wind slashes from his elongated fingernails to engage Luffy in combat.
events.significance: First major confrontation between Eric and Luffy in this episode. Showcases Eric's Devil Fruit abilities in action.

quotes.text: You won't escape with that dragon! I'll slice you all to pieces!
quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric threatening the Straw Hats as he attacks

events.title: Eric's Kama Kama no Tsumujikaze
events.description: Eric demonstrates his signature Devil Fruit technique, Kama Kama no Tsumujikaze (Sickle Sickle Whirlwind), using his sharp fingernails to release razor-sharp wind slashes at his opponents. The attacks cut through the air with deadly precision.
events.significance: Establishes Eric's primary fighting technique and the extent of his Kama Kama no Mi abilities. Shows that he's a formidable Devil Fruit user despite being a filler character.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric calling out his signature wind slash attack

events.title: Luffy Battles Eric
events.description: Luffy engages in combat with Eric, dodging his wind slash attacks while trying to land hits on the mercenary. The battle showcases Luffy's agility and Eric's ranged fighting style.
events.significance: Provides action while the rest of the crew prepares for escape. Demonstrates Luffy's role as the main fighter protecting his crew.

events.title: Marines Surround the Island
events.description: Marine ships under Nelson Royal's command surround Warship Island, attempting to trap the Straw Hats and prevent their escape with Ryu. The Marines create a blockade around the island.
events.significance: Raises the stakes and tension for the Straw Hats' escape plan. Shows the extent of Nelson's forces and determination to capture Ryu.

events.title: Zoro and Usopp Position the Going Merry
events.description: While Luffy fights Eric, Zoro and Usopp work together to maneuver the Going Merry into position for a quick escape. They prepare the ship to set sail at a moment's notice.
events.significance: Shows the crew's teamwork and division of labor during crisis situations. Each member has a role to play in the escape.

events.title: Nami and Apis Load Ryu
events.description: Nami and Apis work to load the weakened dragon Ryu onto a cart so they can transport him to the ship. The ancient dragon is barely conscious and extremely heavy, making the task difficult.
events.significance: Highlights the physical challenge of moving Ryu and the crew's dedication to helping him despite the difficulty and danger.

events.title: Sanji Provides Combat Cover
events.description: Sanji battles Marines who attempt to interfere with the crew's escape preparations. He uses his Black Leg Style to fight off multiple soldiers, providing crucial cover for his crewmates.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's role as one of the crew's main fighters and protectors. Shows the crew's ability to multitask during dangerous situations.

events.title: Apis Uses Her Devil Fruit Power
events.description: Apis communicates with Ryu using her Hiso Hiso no Mi ability, reassuring the dying dragon that they will get him home safely. The dragon responds weakly, showing trust in Apis and her new friends.
events.significance: Reinforces the bond between Apis and Ryu, and demonstrates her unique Devil Fruit ability to communicate telepathically with animals.

quotes.text: Don't worry, Ryu. We'll get you home. I promise!
quotes.speaker: Apis
quotes.context: Apis reassuring Ryu during their escape

events.title: The Escape Begins
events.description: With Ryu secured and the ship ready, the Straw Hats begin their daring escape from Warship Island. They must break through the Marine blockade while protecting the dying dragon.
events.significance: Sets up the continuing action for the next episode. Demonstrates the crew's determination to complete their mission despite overwhelming opposition.

quotes.text: We're getting that dragon back to his home no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring their intent to help Ryu despite the danger

quotes.text: You won't escape with that dragon! I'll slice you all to pieces!
quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric threatening the Straw Hats as he attacks

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.context: Eric calling out his signature wind slash attack

quotes.text: Don't worry, Ryu. We'll get you home. I promise!
quotes.speaker: Apis
quotes.context: Apis reassuring Ryu during their escape

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate their compassionate nature by risking their lives to help Apis return Ryu to his home, even though they have no personal stake in the matter. Their loyalty to their promise drives them forward.
themes.symbolism: Ryu's weakened state represents the vulnerability of those who need help, while the crew's efforts symbolize standing up for the powerless.

themes.description: The episode showcases how each crew member contributes their unique skills during a crisis. From Luffy's fighting to Nami's planning to Apis's communication with Ryu, everyone plays a vital role.
themes.symbolism: The coordinated escape represents the strength found in diverse abilities working toward a common goal.

themes.description: The Straw Hats openly defy the Marines and refuse to hand over Ryu, choosing to do what they believe is right rather than what authority demands.
themes.symbolism: The Marine blockade represents oppressive authority, while the Straw Hats' escape symbolizes freedom and self-determination.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy takes on the main threat to protect his crew and ensure the mission succeeds. His fighting allows the others to prepare for escape.
keyActions: Provides cover for the crew's escape preparations
quotes: We're getting that dragon back to his home no matter what!

characterSpotlights.role: Primary antagonist - Attacks the Straw Hats
characterSpotlights.development: Eric demonstrates his Devil Fruit powers and mercenary ruthlessness, showing he'll do whatever it takes to capture Ryu for his own purposes.
keyActions: Uses Kama Kama no Mi abilities
Launches Kama Kama no Tsumujikaze attack
quotes: You won't escape with that dragon! I'll slice you all to pieces!

characterSpotlights.development: Apis works alongside the Straw Hats, using her Devil Fruit ability to communicate with and comfort Ryu during the dangerous escape.
keyActions: Helps load Ryu onto the cart
Uses Hiso Hiso no Mi to communicate with Ryu
Reassures the dragon during the escape
quotes: Don't worry, Ryu. We'll get you home. I promise!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro takes on a practical role, working with Usopp to ensure the Going Merry is ready for a quick departure.
Usopp contributes his nautical skills to prepare the ship for escape, working alongside Zoro.
keyActions: Works with Zoro on ship preparation
Ensures everything is ready to sail

characterSpotlights.development: Nami takes on the physically demanding task of helping move Ryu, showing her commitment to the crew's mission.
keyActions: Works with Apis to load Ryu
Helps transport the dragon to the cart

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji uses his fighting skills to protect the crew from Marines, allowing the others to focus on Ryu and the ship.
keyActions: Provides combat cover for the crew

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is filler content and does not appear in the manga. The Warship Island Arc was created exclusively for the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of the Warship Island Arc (episodes 54-61), which is the first full filler arc in the One Piece anime, created to give the manga time to get ahead.

sources.title: Warship Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode achieved a 14.7% TV rating in Japan and ranked 6th for its broadcast week, showing strong viewership despite being filler content.
Eric's voice actor in Japanese, Ryūsei Nakao, is famous for voicing Frieza in Dragon Ball Z, giving Eric a distinctively villainous voice.
The Warship Island Arc creates continuity issues with later canon material, particularly regarding the existence of dragons and Zoro's ability to cut steel.

sources.title: Warship Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Kama Kama no Mi (Sickle-Sickle Fruit) is one of the first filler-exclusive Devil Fruits introduced in the anime, never appearing in the manga.
The episode's eyecatcher features Usopp and Zoro, highlighting their teamwork in preparing the ship for escape.
